Tutorial - Action Adventure Game

If you want to see tutorial in a separate web browswer window click here.

Overview

This tutorial is intended for those who are looking at creating their first Role Playing Action Adventure game. This is an introduction to building a framework to build a game on top of.

Unlike other tutorials, I have left the scripting in images so you can't cut and paste the text. When learning to script, I think it is very important to type it in yourself and get used to making mistakes and develop an understanding of what you are typing does to the game engine and how to fix problems that arise.

Double click rm_castle and deselect the Instances, Background_Transparent_Tiles and Background_Opaque_Tiles. This leaves us with the far background layer which is the Background_Animated_Tiles. The only animated element we have is the water which is being used as a moat to surround the castle.

Go back to rm_castle and select the Background_Opaque_Tiles, and we have all the solid tiles that represent all the surfaces. Only half the level is completed. You will complete the rest.

Open rm_castle and select the Background_Transparent_Tiles

Notice that the room size is larger than a screen and represents the entire level and is 4096 by 4096. Run the game by pressing the Play Button. See that the entire level is scaled to fit on the screen and is a square ratio:

Now the problem is that our room is 4096 x 4096. We want it to be the standard default 1024 by 768. How do we create a camera in the level that follows our character so we can navigate this level? Double click your rm_castle and look at the bottom left for Viewports and Cameras.

Click on the arrow to open the menu. Click the tab Viewports and Cameras in the Room | Properties section. Click to open the triangle for Viewport 0. Click on the radio button for Enable Viewports and Clear Viewport Background (which clears untiled areas with the background color). In the Viewport 0 click on the Visible radio button. Then keep the Camera and Vieport properties at their default settings which is 1024 x 768.

Run the game by pressing the Play Button. Now it plays the top left corner of the level and is only playing a portion of the level. This is exactly what we wanted. We will have it follow th player on the next page.
